hotspots.text: Jonny uses a wonderful tremolo guitar at the [Coachella '04](https://youtu.be/HTIC34OwkoA?t=34) rather than the keyboard synth used during numerous other [live performances](https://youtu.be/sVpQ9B2-riw?t=329).
I think Colin did a great job with the bass throughout!
Really cool alternate riff used during [Belfort '97](https://youtu.be/fIGuEnIT2ro?t=2943). Reminds me of the doppler effect you may hear passing by sirens. Really wish this was on the studio version.

[Chicago Metro '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=3542)
Contrary to popular belief, 'The Bends' was not intentionally written about Creep, but I still think it's surprisingly poetic.

You should check out Jonny's alternate riffs (and guitar *string bends*) live on [Jools Holland '95](https://youtu.be/wsPySuZu6SU). I think this is hands-down the best live performance of this song, just wish it was in higher quality.

I think I prefer the alternate riff played in performances such as [Chicago Metro '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=3600), [Barcelona '97](https://youtu.be/7z9wu4b9d2Q?t=58), [San Francisco '98](https://youtu.be/W35G3rVOfwY?t=2750) or notably, [Glastonbury '97](https://youtu.be/ATvonKDt6jQ?t=911) (quite wonderful). Perhaps it's because I've listened to the studio riff too many times. I'm not sure.

Earlier lyrics from the [Chicago Metro '93](https://youtu.be/3hf1XOAdSf8?t=937) feature 'brought in the submarines, the tanks and the whole marines'. Thom's acoustic guitar here is another interesting difference which I think sounds kind of cool.
I like the different stressing of *'to blow me away'* at [Pinkpop '96](https://youtu.be/sVpQ9B2-riw?t=2241)

media.text: Check out the ['95 Black Sessions](https://youtu.be/3VIIxdwC_PY?t=189) recording... Thom holds this note for quite a while. I really love the screams he does here for buildup too.

hotspots.text: Check out Jonny's extra sounds here at [Astoria '94](https://youtu.be/RjQZd8p-eBM?t=1254)
So many different riffs from different live performances here. Check out [Barcelona '97](https://youtu.be/7z9wu4b9d2Q?t=58)
I've been trying to find the full live performance of The Bends at [Rock am Ring '94](https://youtu.be/lslIyogYkMY)... If you can find it please dm me üò≠
I'll be honest, I kinda hate this song üò≠

That being said, I think the [Chicago '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=2517) performance sounds pretty cool, especially here. Thank you Jonny. I wish the coin guitar sounds were in the studio version.
Check out [2 Meter Sessions '95](https://youtu.be/EhiJ1OU5NJc?t=69) or [Jools Holland '95](https://youtu.be/9KgZQ9R6-SM?t=74) for a different-sounding chorus.
Another shoutout to [Chicago '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=2582), which sounds really nice here.
In some performances, Thom sings along at this part. Perhaps a bit goofy but I find it fun. There's also an alternate riff on [Jay Leno '96](https://youtu.be/mt-AGIB43Hk?t=174)
It took longer for me to like this song than I would like to admit...
Earlier versions, including live at [The Astoria '94](https://youtu.be/RjQZd8p-eBM?t=2200) have different instrumental introductions.
Jonny makes a lotta nice sounds here on some live performances
Thom holds the higher note in performances like [Belfort '97](https://youtu.be/fIGuEnIT2ro?t=2255) or [Glastonbury '03](https://youtu.be/2Vo4WutBoq4?t=2477), which I think sounds absolutely majestic.
I think payoff in [Belfort '97](https://youtu.be/fIGuEnIT2ro?t=2351) sounds incredible here.
I think I liked this the first 3 times I listened to it.
Unfortunately this never grew on me...
I didn't like this at first, but it's alright. You should check out [this](https://youtu.be/eJddqw8U20c) hilarious playback performance
I will always love My Iron Lung ‚ù§Ô∏è
Notably, the studio version is identical to their [Astoria '94](https://youtu.be/RjQZd8p-eBM?t=1342) performance, except with replaced vocals. I think both sound great.
Colin does an amazing job with the bass here, even [slapping](https://youtu.be/-46u9fQaFOU?t=106) in the choruses. I wish it was turned up a bit in studio.
Their performance at [Nulle Part Ailleurs '95](https://youtu.be/ywY_eJCQ-xc?t=186) is also shockingly great, there are some extra sounds here.
For what it's worth, their [2 Meter Sessions](https://youtu.be/sdtKjByGGHM) would be my third favourite. Unfortunately, many other live performances have been recorded with poor quality.
Great song and one of my favourite vocal performances from Thom. The acoustic version is pretty cool too.
I prefer the intro at [Chicago Metro '96](https://youtu.be/5ihwFCY74As) rather than the studio fade-in.
The [Astoria '94](https://youtu.be/RjQZd8p-eBM?&t=620) has slightly different chorus harmonies in addition to starting suddenly rather than fading in.
I CANNOT get over this bridge... The bass really does it for me.
Maybe I don't hate this song as much as High and Dry, but it evokes no reaction from me so I just don't listen.
I like.
Honestly, just listen to the [Astoria '94](https://youtu.be/RjQZd8p-eBM?t=1780). It is WAY better.

tracklist.name: You Never Wash Up After Yourself

hotspots.text: Check out the opening on an [early airbag](https://youtu.be/6Z-0mcY2TME). Fits nicely between The Bends and OK Computer.
I really love Jonny's guitar wizardry, everything sounds great live too! Check out [Glastonbury '97](https://youtu.be/mQ6wTt8eIfw?t=108)
It's really interesting to listen to all the different instrumentals at this part. One of my favourites is at [Jools Holland '97](https://youtu.be/BAbprjVHbYA?t=208)
The screech Thom does at the [10Spot](https://youtu.be/kmsB1FF34BY?t=240) is really wonderful. I think this is my favourite live version.
I know this comes off as generic, but this is my favourite radiohead song.
Really great call and response here

I really would have loved if the screeches present in [Jools Holland '97](https://youtu.be/NzPtr_n-m8A?t=348) were on studio. Either way, I think that performance is by far the best live version of this song.
One of my favourite openings of all time
I was shocked when I first found out this was performed live. I think the [10spot](https://youtu.be/byN3JDPoJRo) performance is their best.
Unfortunately, this song never clicked for me... üò≠
Great song! Check out the early intro/outro from [OK Outtakes](https://youtu.be/1D7GqtnjkSY). I think both versions sound amazing.
I'm dead serious when I say I'd listen to this over Exit Music. Good interlude.
I actually prefer the [Chicago Metro '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=564) version with Ed's vocals. Album version is alright though.
Underrated in my opinion. Check out the [BBC live](https://youtu.be/y6KYb03zJHM) version, which has a remarkable intro.
Check out the [live debut](https://youtu.be/AJozUVc1lyg?)! Aside from the earlier lyrics, it's cool to see Thom's percussion and whatever wizardry Jonny is doing.
During some live performances, Thom screams into his guitar during this part.
This song has grown on me a ton. I think either [Nulle Part Ailleurs '97](https://youtu.be/EEtbPDOYkjg) or [this](https://youtu.be/eu5LGa028Wk) is my favourite live performance of the song.
I really love the mellotron (?) or synth used here. I think it sounds great at [Glastonbury '03](https://youtu.be/SCOSb2_QPdk?t=141) but I ultimately prefer the studio version.
Thom and Ed's vocals really sound incredible here in [Jools Holland '01](https://youtu.be/_HCqrA9rxeY?t=217), I wish this was in studio.
This took ages to grow on me. Honestly, check out the [10Spot](https://youtu.be/KSHXD93akOE) version, great stuff.
The microplastics song. Check out the great live performance at [New York '98](https://youtu.be/Md71N_9Vi_w?t=5290).
Glad they finally released this. I really dig the [Kid A Theory](https://youtu.be/asjYgAMjfUU) version, wish the studio version was more like it.
This song was initially called OK Computer. I find it quite relevant in my life.
did they predict short form content üòÇüòÇüòÇ
You can hear this in the [Meeting People Is Easy](https://youtu.be/1pdjNfjjuLM) documentary. I would like to make an edit with this one day.
I initially found the heavily processed guitars offputting, but now I figure it's supposed to be offputting. Look at the lyrics.
Check out the intro on the [OK Outtakes](https://youtu.be/XU-dNS6lKXo) version. Honestly, I might prefer this version more.
[Chicago '96](https://youtu.be/jBwGywTTU30?t=2735) and [Pinkpop '96](https://youtu.be/sVpQ9B2-riw?t=1861) are really great too! I wish the studio version was mixed more similarly to these.

Kid A is my favourite album. It didn't click until I listened to it after several days of no sleep, while fading in and out of dreaming. The experience was otherworldly and nothing has matched it yet.

Many of the live versions are nice, I don't really like any one in particular more than the others, but [Jools Holland '01](https://youtu.be/_GFxGBz49qU) has been growing on me. Anyway, studio clears.
Please do check out this [edit](https://youtu.be/GxazaEiu41M). It's really good.
one of my favourite songs of all time. it is difficult to describe how this felt when it clicked for me, but it really changed me.
Do check out the early live version at [Berlin '01](https://youtu.be/tZhnUWCDuo4). I think it sounds cool except the harmonica at the end which I feel doesn't mesh too well with the album.
[KID A MNESIA Exhibition](https://youtu.be/UNPEU0JXRoM) features a pretty cool instrumental.
Great song with a killer bassline.
Jonny uses an Ondes Martenot at [Jools Holland '01](https://youtu.be/ZVnaLsZBJiw?t=35), which sounds wonderful. I'm a big fan of him using this instrument, especially later in their discography.
I feel like they always perform well at [Nulle Part Ailleurs](https://youtu.be/3Y5hrM_qQAI?t=2129). Awful well in France for an Enlish band.
Even the live versions with more guitar-centric instrumentation still sound amazing.
It lingers. I think the tense strings embody that feeling excellently.
I love the Ondes Martenot here, done especially well at [Bonaroo '06](https://youtu.be/DhhWWGEzRL0?&t=190) I consider it the same "voice" as the one in Where I End and You Begin.
Check out the amazing performance at [Nulle part Ailleurs '01](https://youtu.be/3Y5hrM_qQAI?t=1486).
This part is especially cathartic. If you enjoy the strings, you may want to check out [How to Disappear into Strings](https://youtu.be/1ACmCuuIaMQ?).
Alright interlude. I find it really calming.
If you enjoy this, you may want to check out the [Extended Version](https://youtu.be/5T-ztaDz750)
It took me a while to understand this track's place on Kid A. The payoff is really nice.
Obligatory check out the live [From the Basement](https://youtu.be/jQCJKWEFyG4) performance.
The performance at Scott Walker's [Meltdown](https://youtu.be/VJVPTO3Yyno) is really nice too. I wish a higher quality recording was available.
I really enjoy the performance at [BBC Studios](https://youtu.be/Sp_FvbSO1D4?t=243) at this part, however I understand the studio version's restraint.
The title describes exactly it feels.
Check out [Mild und Leise](https://youtu.be/0kyuoAsZ_ns?t=43), which was sampled for this. It's a really interesting work from 1973.
This [rehearsal](https://youtu.be/1GBqFknWDzw?t=49) has superior lyrics :]
did radiohead [predict](https://www.reddit.com/r/radioheadcirclejerk/comments/i19oj8/remember_when_thom_predicted_the_movie_ice_age/) the ice age movie?

This part sounds absolutely insane at [Nulle Part Ailleurs](https://youtu.be/Z9Zh1MrgBvQ?t=177). Apparently Jonny's synth got sabotaged and Thom chipped his tooth on the mic. This is by far my favourite live version but I wonder how it would have sound if not for these mishaps.
A few other nice live performances includes a different [Nulle Part Ailleurs](https://youtu.be/3Y5hrM_qQAI?t=3729) session and [Jools Holland '01](https://youtu.be/0MmpUIdGcyU)
The superior Morning Bell (sorry, Amnesiac)
This part sounds amazing at [Nulle Part Ailleurs](https://youtu.be/0OI9qnrXBPg?t=121). I'm surprised they managed to do it with guitars.
[Jools Holland '01](https://youtu.be/O2S6J4SHZV0?t=217) sounds really nice here
Incredible closer.
This song was written quite a while before Kid A. You can find an earlier version [here](https://youtu.be/BY9DWD6CRDQ). The third verse is really nice.
Check out the the [Minidisc](https://youtu.be/Vapo21HsyaI) version if you want more. This one feels like something off The Bends.
This plays after a few seconds of silence on the CD version.

tracklist.name: Packt Like Sardines In a Crushd Tin Box
Where I End and You Begin
A Punch Up at a Wedding
The Place Where He Inserted the Blade
In the Absence of Strong Evidence to the Contrary, One May Step Out of the Way of the Charging Bull
Delivering the Groceries at 138 Beats Per Minute
Slice Where You Live Like Pie
From the Desk of Elsewhere Go
